snippet: Out of a tense meeting grew a frantic effort aimed at rescuing not only the troubled insurance portal and President Obama’s credibility, but also the Democratic philosophy that an activist government can solve complex social problems.
abstract: Story of how Obama administration confronted botched rollout of federal health care Web site reveals an insular White House that did not initially appreciate the magnitude of its self-inflicted wounds; out of a tense Oval Office meeting grew a frantic effort aimed at rescuing not only the troubled insurance portal and Obama's credibility, but also the Democratic philosophy that government can solve complex social problems.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Reed Abelson and Sharon LaFraniere from New York, Ian Austen from Ottawa, and Robert Pear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Out of a tense meeting grew a frantic effort aimed at rescuing not only the troubled insurance portal and President Obama’s credibility, but also the Democratic philosophy that an activist government can solve complex social problems.

headline.main: Inside the Race to Rescue a Health Care Site, and Obama
headline.print_headline: Inside the Race to Rescue a Health Site, and Obama
